claim: Vaccination with a higher-dose recombinant flu vaccine may induce a more robust antibody response than egg-based standard-dose vaccines.

new_evidence.quote: 5. TreanorJJ, Schiff GM, Hayden fg, et.al. Safety and immunogen i city of aba culo virus expressed hemagglutinin influenza vaccine: a randomized controlled trial. JAMA. 2007 Vol. 297, pp. 1577-1582.
new_evidence.relevance_explanation: This reference is to a published randomized controlled trial specifically evaluating the immunogenicity (antibody response) of a recombinant hemagglutinin influenza vaccine, which supports the claim that such vaccines may induce a robust antibody response.

new_evidence.quote: 3 Keitel WA Tre an or JJ El Sahly HM et al Comparative immunogen i city of recom- nant influenza hemagglutinin (rHA) and trivalent in activated vaccines (TIVs) among rsons ≥65 years old Vaccine 2009 Vol 28 pp 379 385
new_evidence.relevance_explanation: This reference describes a comparative immunogenicity study between recombinant hemagglutinin (rHA) and standard trivalent inactivated vaccines (TIVs) in older adults, directly supporting the claim about differences in antibody response.
